wikipedia_page.main: Gerald Walter Erskine Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst, JP DL LLB (25 October 1861 – 30 April 1936) was a British barrister, businessman and Conservative politician. He is best remembered for developing the gardens at Wakehurst Place, Sussex.

link_mentions.page: William Beauclerk, 10th Duke of St Albans
response: *Lady Louise de Vere Beauclerk (12 April 1869 – 15 December 1958), married Gerald Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst and had issue.

link_mentions.page: Gerald Walter Erskine Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst

response: Gerald Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst, was the fifth son of the first Baronet.

link_mentions.page: Donald Howard, 3rd Baron Strathcona and Mount Royal
response: On 25 October 1922 Strathcona married Hon Diana Evelyn Loder, daughter of Gerald Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst and Lady Louise de Vere Beauclerk, a daughter of William Beauclerk, 10th Duke of St Albans.  They had five children:

It was donated by Gerald Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst in 1926 to "encourage and honour New Zealanders who work to investigate, promote, retain and cherish our indigenous flora". The Minister of Conservation awards the Loder Cup to a person or group of people who best represent the objectives of the Cup.
* Gerald Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst (1861–1936), British barrister, businessman, and politician
* Gerald Loder, 1st Baron Wakehurst (1861–1936). He  married Lady Louise de Vere Beauclerk, eldest daughter of William Beauclerk, 10th Duke of St Albans, in 1890.
